intro: Medicosma subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive corolla shape. It is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Medicosoma subsessilis is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic to some animals and insects.
